meanings.definition: A blow or hit that knocks someone or something down.
meanings.sent1: The boxer delivered powerful knockdowns during the match.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake caused several knockdowns in the city.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's playful knockdowns always make everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fierce winds were like relentless knockdowns on the trees.
meanings.sent5: The demolition crew used controlled knockdowns to bring down the old building.

meanings.definition: A reduction in price or value.
meanings.sent1: The store offered huge knockdowns on all their products.
meanings.sent2: The knockdown in housing prices attracted many buyers.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected knockdown in prices made shoppers ecstatic.
meanings.sent4: The knockdown in stock value left investors worried.
meanings.sent5: The knockdown in ticket prices led to a sold-out event.

meanings.definition: The act of disassembling or taking apart a structure.
meanings.sent1: The knockdowns of the old house revealed hidden treasures.
meanings.sent2: The knockdowns of the stage set were done swiftly after the play.
meanings.sent3: The knockdowns of the Lego tower were met with cheers and applause.
meanings.sent4: The knockdowns of the puzzle pieces made it easier to solve.
meanings.sent5: The knockdowns of the scaffolding marked the end of construction.
